summary: This bill, the Retaining Essential Support for Combat and Unified Evacuation Act of 2025 (RESCUE Act), mandates the preservation of the Army's aeromedical evacuation capabilities within the Medical Service Corps. It requires the Army to maintain dedicated aeromedical evacuation personnel, training, doctrine, and aircraft, and specifies the Secretary of the Army's responsibilities to ensure this.  The bill also places limits on restructuring or changing allocations, requiring congressional notification and consultation with the Surgeon General. It takes effect 180 days after enactment and does not prohibit augmentation with other assets.
